task.summary: Default task
2/21/18 Progress - Filled out and implemented upgrades with non-unique effects - Implemented scrolling in popup menus

2/22/18 Progress - Added support to the save-load system for upgrades. Upgrades are now properly saved and reloaded + reapplied on loading a game. - Tweaked turn submission indicator to show each player (so you can tell when the other player is waiting on you) - Tweaked prices for just about everything to be less uniform - Added scrolling to main menu - Added order preview when the MENU2 key is held. Needs improvement around movement mostly to show origin -> destination

2/26/18 Support for creating an executable
- Added dependency on cx_freeze - Changes to directory structures and how we find resource paths to accomodate being in an executable - First built executable!
Added missing build directory (how gauche)
Undo previous commit, remove build dir and just publish the .zip file

2/26/18 Progress
- Build support for converting to an executable - Automatically builds a ZIP file of the build dir when compiled - Networking improvements - Client receives the entire game state from the host when they connect, and loads it - Can now specify an IP to connect to via a text file (untested)

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'
# Conflicts: # Terra.zip
Clean reupload of ZIP file
Clean reupload of ZIP file

2/28/18 Progress - Added Guardian and Boltcaster units - Implemented ranged AOE attribute for Boltcaster. Damages adjacent targets on ranged attack. - Implemented armor share attribute for Guardian. Grants temporary armor every turn to adjacent allies. - Moved from health integer display to health bars. Easier to work with and parse with strange max hp values. - Added events for end of each phase - Added default piece attributes, to enable defining a sparse map for piece attributes - Added piece archetypes, for easier categorizing of pieces, and defining damage multipliers

3/1/18 Progress - Added Banshee unit - Fixed lots of small things in Kegan's todo list - Removed NONE tiletype - Show 'not enough resources' effect on all pieces spending resources - Rename Wait -> Cancel, only show Cancel option when we have an existing order - Made ESC / MENU key back out of menus wherever possible - Fixed digit display, made it right justified. - Split movement types into passable and traversable tile types, with corresponding update to movement tile selection - Fixed level editor not saving maps - Divided all resources by 5. Much easier to remember (2 3 1) than it is (10 15 5).

3/4/18 Progress - Added all missing upgrades - Added upgrades for all tier 2 units, and filled in missing tier 1 upgrades - Added unique effects for ignoring contesting, regen, terraforming, healing adjacent, armor piercing, AOE on kill and steal on kill effects, and movement buffs from allies. - Fixed invalid orders where you could try to buy the same upgrade multiple times - Added support for terraforming! Terraforming raises or lowers a tile, changing its type. - Pieces that end the turn on impassible terrain take lots of damage. - Standardized damaging and healing pieces in the piece class

3/5/18 Progress - Added Coast tiles, which use an indexed sprite (like sea borders), and have 4 frames of animation. - Added HEAVY movement type, which allows traversal over coasts and hills but not stopping on them. - Added support for animated indexed sprites, like coasts. - Added global animation sync for 4-frame animations, like tiles - Added rudimentary sound effects - Major fixes for level editor - Support for adding and removing pieces - Some bugfixes for keybindings and behavior that should only happen during a real battle

3/7/18 Progress - Added detail box, which can display description text for options, and details about a piece or upgrade - Using this, added full descriptions for all menu options, upgrades, and pieces - Added utilities for caching and drawing text more easily, as well as utilities for drawing multi line text - Split game screen and UI screen better, and fixed support for smaller maps
Hotfix for missing init file - Fixed that the sound module didn't have an init file.

3/8/18 Progress - Added Tower and Techlab buildings. - Upped framerate to 60. Should result in smoother input and feel. - Fixed bug around submitting a turn, then revising it, and canceling an order not being updated properly in a networked game. - Fixed upgrades not being purchaseable from more than one type of building.

3/8/18 Progress 2 - Reworked all resource costs to be a 1-resource system, instead of 3. - Unified the three generator types - Simplified the phase bar UI and menu popup price UI - Added cost UI to order previews - Added smooth camera scrolling

3/13/18 Progress - Added mouse support to the main menu - Prettied up the main menu a little - Added support for a text input, integrated it into new level editor maps and specifying an IP to connect to for network games - Updated coast orphan tiles (no neighboring land) - Added 'demolish' order type for buildings, to destroy themselves - Added 'fill with tile' command to level editor

3/14/18 Progress - Updated visual style of popup menus, phasebars, and related icons to match the new main menu - Added scrollbars to long menus - Added icons to the main menu - Pieces now no longer count allies who can move as blocking building stuff onto that tile - Pieces that can't attack buildings also now don't interrupt / contest them

3/15/18 Progress - Added error handling to netcode. - Should now abort JOINs if they take too long - Should gracefully shut down and return to main menu when the session ends for whatever reason - If the host crashes, it will attempt to save the game - Added some minor error logging, mainly for networked games - Fixed that debug keys worked in networked games - Added Bristle Plains map.

3/19/18 Progress - Moved upgrade and piece attribute definitions to external files, for easier testing - Fixed some bugs with pieces contesting when they had no melee attack - Fixed error log and map logs conflicting - Added a very very broad catchall that logs fatal exceptions
3/20 Quick commit - Added Spear Point map - Added popup messages for when clients connect or disconnect

3/21/18 Progress - Fixed STEAL and AOE on death effects not working - Added minimap rendering / map preview to main menu - Added game icon and window caption - Added turn banner UI - Reworked toast notifications to render in new menu style

3/22/18 Progress - Rendering optimizations for tiles and pieces - Tiles and Pieces now no longer render if they're outside the camera viewport - Animated sprites now just use subsurfaces rather than slicing the sprite up and storing it as a list - Added settings menu, and enabling saving and loading those settings from a file in the attributes dir - Added metadata to map format, allowing storing and saving the current phase and turn number. Can be expanded to other flat k/v pairs
3/23/18 Progress - Added results screen to the end of battles, and victory checking + conceding - Added statistics, which get displayed on the results screen

3/24/18 Progress - Added simplex noise functions for generating somewhat coherent random maps - Added mirror (axis) menu options to level editor - Added idle animations to all units - Added palettes for green and yellow teams

3/24/18 Progress - Added simplex noise functions for generating somewhat coherent random maps - Added mirror (axis) menu options to level editor - Added idle animations to all units - Added palettes for green and yellow teams

3/26/18 Progress - Network improvements - Handling for assigning arbitrary teams to players based on the map data - Smooth handling for concessions and the game ending - Nickname settings in the settings menu - Bugfix for revising orders not being synced to other players - Network lobby -- not complete or fully functional, but the groundwork is there. Currently disabled in code.
Stashing before attempting event refactor - Fixed error in piece preview display - Fixed some level editor bugs w/ teams

3/30 Event + Input refactor - Added EventBus object, in charge of marshalling events to subscribers - Refactored all game event handling to use this - Refactored event constants - Added InputController object, in charge of translating game input and marhsalling events to subscribers - Refactored all game input handling to use this - Refactored input key constants - Lots of fixes for newly sprung data leaks

4/1 Progress - Updated handling of a team being knocked out / having their base destroyed / conceding, to flow better and handle 3+ team games - Updated piece conflicts to handle 3+ combatants - Tweaks to asset loading to make it simpler, and work correctly from within unit tests - Added test to generate a table of every unit fighting every other unit, to determine TTK and breakpoints - Revised Yellow team palette to not be eye-bleeding

4/3 Progress - Added timing between phases, to allow for animation and better understanding of how the turn plays out - Added minor animations for phase actions - Pieces now animate and move to their destination for Move orders - Ranged attacks now show a tracer from the piece to the target - Walk animations for Colonists and Troopers - Added 'heal' action to damaged pieces - Added a font for a more consistent look
4/4 Progress - Updated the map preview UI on the main menu + unit preview for maps - Added display for upgrade results to the detail box - Added walk animations to all units

4/5 Progress - Improved the network lobby to the point where it is basically functional - Added map preview - Added menu + notifications for when teams are full and the game is ready, so the host can start the game - Made the map preview panel generic

4/6 Bugfix - Minor bugfix for level editor not responding to inputs - Added basic T3 units. No sprites for any of it, but the basic stats are implemented - Code quality-- added comments here and there, and some TODOs

4/9 Progress - Refactored 'managers' objects into a Session container. Cleaned up how games / modes are initialized. - Reworked tile selection to use Dijkstra's algorithm - Added debug controller, which fires events based on debug key inputs. Removed other debug inputs. - Added upgrade display to piece detail box - Refactored error logging to always exist (and not be a part of managers) - Refactored combat logger to just listen for events, and not be manually invoked - Refactored map util methods out of map manager

4/11 Progress - Added sprites and upgrades for all T3 units - Added new attributes for lifesteal and ranged cratering - Profiling -> plugging some memory leaks to do with Session and managers - Some refactoring to move stuff to their own directories - Added shells for maps to correspond with the letters of the alphabet
4/12 Progress - Added Menu base class, refactored popup menus and the main menu to use it - Prettied up the stats screen a bit - Added a map or two

4/16 Progress - Added lobby to local games (not just network), refactored out menu - Added the rest of the initial set of maps - Added neutral palette + units, support for neutrals - Neutrals deal damage, but have no AI and no team. Mostly act as roadblocks in maps

4/17 Progress - Added Manual / Tutorial to main menu - Added effects for combat (pieces hit, theft upgrade proc, sabotage upgrade proc) - Fixed some bugs around effects not showing up and pressing unknown mouse buttons
Initial AI - Created AI players, insert them in for teams - Added pathfinding and task allocation - Rudimentary Colonist AI-- Colonists will seek out resource tiles and build generators on them

AI functionality 4/23 - Generates and executes RETREAT, ATTACK, MOVE_TO_RESOURCE, HARVEST, rough BUILD_UNIT tasks - Assignment creation and prioritization / scoring - Planned spending + basic planned occupied coords (not complete understanding) - Pathfinding and understanding how to move partially along a path, avoid bad engagements - Basics of AI personality, not much usage of those settings yet though
Stashing before refactoring AI planning algorithm - Putting pathfinding in the 'confirm assignments' phase, rather than when creating assignments

AI Planning phase refactor - Reworked path planning to occur when confirming assignments. This allows the AI to properly account for where pieces -will- be on the next turn - Pathfinding can now be provided with a list of 'blocked' coords that it should avoid - Ranged units pathfind properly-- ranged units will approach their target to just within their range, and then take shots - Weighted unit production choices by personality - AI can now build barracks (heuristics are very rough as to where and when)

AI Update 4/27 - Added general distance map. Navigates from all points towards the enemy HQ. - Aids in understanding map shape and accessible territory. - Tasks that need distances use this map rather than pathfinding - Added skeleton for research tasks - Updates to harvest task generation, better math for desired numbers of Colonists and Barracks - Leftover pieces now move randomly to a tile in range to make room for other pieces with important orders - Moved actual determination of orders to after the player submits their turn for better flow - This is controlled by a debug var right now-- the old pattern is still there for testing

AI Update 4/30 - Research tasks are generated (mostly randomly) - Added support to the pregame lobby to add/remove the AI player. - Basic functionality is unhacked, so all normal games can be played again post-AI refactor.

AI + Tweaks 5/6 Tweaks: - Removed entrenchment, replaced upgrades concerning entrenchment - Reworked resource production upgrades to not be ridiculous - Piece attribute tweaks - cheaper colonists, tweaked damage thresholds for Troopers, Rangers, and Ghosts - Re-enabled animation speed setting (locked to speed 4 in network games) - Added UI to show when an action you're considering might be contested by an enemy - Cleanup phase now only occurs at the end of turns, like originally intended - Bugfix for tile selection for HEAVY movement not understanding traversable / passable difference AI: - Added mild multithreading for when AI players plan their turns (significantly reduces stuttering / lag), UI to show when the AI is 'thinking' - Added scoring for which upgrades to purchase - Added more personality thresholds and wired them up - Support for building higher tier units

SFX and Level Editor Refactor 5/9 - Added a bunch of (rough) SFX. Not fully wired up to all their triggers yet - Refactored Cursor into two objects (BattleCursor and EditorCursor) with a common ancestor in Cursor, which handlers moving the cursor, etc - Refactored level editor functionality out of LevelEditor screen and into EditorCursor - Added autosaves to Battle and Editor

Bugfixes and tweaks 5/10 - Removed input handler from screens. Refactored results screen into two objects. - Fixed bug where saved maps would be recorded as saves, not maps - Fixed bug where player Colonists could build generators (and other buildings) on top of enemy buildings - Added piece preview -- press Menu2 on a piece in the world to see details about it. - Added support to detailbox / piece preview for multiple pieces at once - Added multi-place support to the level editor (click and drag) - Fixed that clicks in the window to gain focus would count for game logic

MESSAGE.value: 3/22/18 Progress - Rendering optimizations for tiles and pieces - Tiles and Pieces now no longer render if they're outside the camera viewport - Animated sprites now just use subsurfaces rather than slicing the sprite up and storing it as a list - Added settings menu, and enabling saving and loading those settings from a file in the attributes dir - Added metadata to map format, allowing storing and saving the current phase and turn number. Can be expanded to other flat k/v pairs

Currently disabled in code.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Bugfixes and tweaks 5/10 - Removed input handler from screens. Refactored results screen into two objects. - Fixed bug where saved maps would be recorded as saves, not maps - Fixed bug where player Colonists could build generators (and other buildings) on top of enemy buildings - Added piece preview -- press Menu2 on a piece in the world to see details about it. - Added support to detailbox / piece preview for multiple pieces at once - Added multi-place support to the level editor (click and drag) - Fixed that clicks in the window to gain focus would count for game logic
